[LoSoTo] </title>         <link>http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:user_software:start&rev=1426072784&do=diff</link>         <description>This page will redirect you to build instructions for the LOFAR common software packages. Unfortunately there are two confusing names for two very different software bases:   *  LOFAR Software -> the package used and maintained by ASTRON containing control software, pipelines, AwImager, AOFlagger; this is the package developed and elaborated and used in the LOFAR production environment  *  LUS (LOFAR USer Software) -> package maintained by the KSPs (Key Science projects) containing the pulsar pi\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:user_software:losot&rev=1426072684&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-11T12:18:04+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>Andreas Horneffer</dc:creator>         <title>public:user_software:losot - old revision restored (2015/03/11 11:39)</title>         <link>http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:user_software:losot&rev=1426072684&do=diff</link>         <description>*  Tested/installed on flits   # First create a virtual environment virtualenv losoto # Enter the environment with the following command source losoto/bin/activate pip install numpy pip install numexpr pip install cython Download HDF5 and untar it ./configure --prefix=/home/user/bin/hdf5; make; make install export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/home/user/bin/hdf5/lib" and HDF5_DIR="/home/user/bin/hdf5" pip install tables pip install progressbar pip install matplotlib</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:ssh-usage&rev=1425894561&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-09T10:49:21+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>Teun Grit</dc:creator>         <title>public:ssh-usage - [SSH Port forwarding / tunneling] </title>         <link>http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:ssh-usage&rev=1425894561&do=diff</link>         <description>We use the Secure Shell (ssh) on CEP to connect to different systems. This page explains how this can be used without having to supply a password each time you want to connect to a system. The image below tries to explain the process:  With normal ssh you always have to give a password. If you use a private and public key, you can access systems where your public key is in $HOME/.ssh/authorized_keys from the system where you have the private key. With the ssh-agent explained below, you can ssh t\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?image=public%3Alsm_new%3A2015_03_04_iacobelli.pdf&ns=public%3Alsm_new&rev=1425467850&tab_details=history&mediado=diff&do=media">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-04T12:17:30+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>roberto pizzo</dc:creator>         <title>public:lsm_new:2015_03_04_iacobelli.pdf - Though we w\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:user_software:dynspec_tutorial&rev=1415870188&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-11-13T10:16:28+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>Jean-Mathias Griessmeier</dc:creator>         <title>public:user_software:dynspec_tutorial</title>         <link>http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:user_software:dynspec_tutorial&rev=1415870188&do=diff</link>         <description>Download Sun Data for the tutorial  Use the following link to download the ICD3 Sun data (3.5 GB):  DATA  Unzip:   unzip Sun.zip  :!: Throughout this tutorial, the following variables are used:  Observation directory (where all ICD3 files are located - that's the files you just downloaded): $OBS_DIR  Output directory (where the Dynspec will be generated): $OUTPUT_DIR  Dynspec filename: $FILENAME    Best define them now.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:user_software:dynspec_tutorial_jupiter&rev=1415870171&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-11-13T10:16:11+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>Jean-Mathias Griessmeier</dc:creator>         <title>public:user_software:dynspec_tutorial_jupiter - [Return links] </title>         <link>http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:user_software:dynspec_tutorial_jupiter&rev=1415870171&do=diff</link>         <description>This page provide to DTC users a tutorial to familiarize with the use of the DTC. Exception for the <<Visualization>>, it is a python graphical interface coded in Tkinter.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:user_software:dynspec_tools&rev=1415869967&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-11-13T10:12:47+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>Jean-Mathias Griessmeier</dc:creator>         <title>public:user_software:dynspec_tools - [Return links] </title>         <link>http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:user_software:dynspec_tools&rev=1415869967&do=diff</link>         <description>How to use DTC package: details of each tool  In this section, functionality, usage and parameters are presented. Two main categories of tools are available:   *  Tools whose the name start with <<Beam...>> do the Beam formed data (ICD3) conversion to dynspec data (ICD6), with or without rebinning.   *  Tools whose the name start with <<Dynspec...>> work on dynspec data (ICD6). They offer rebinning, recomputation of the  polarization, subtraction and visualization.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:user_software:dynspec&rev=1415866613&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-11-13T09:16:53+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>Arno Schoenmakers</dc:creator>         <title>public:user_software:dynspec - [INSTALL DTC] </title>         <link>http://www.lofar.org/operations/doku.php?id=public:user_software:dynspec&rev=1415866613&do=diff</link>         <description>This page is be the central information point for the Dynspec Toolkit Container (DTC). LOFAR observations can be recorded in datafiles in the Beam Formed data format (ICD3 format, see below).
